intro: Tovomita calyptrata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are often used in ornamental horticulture. Tovomita calyptrata prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
